div.p: What can go wrong and how to handle it
What Happened: Broadcaster's WiFi drops RTMP connection lost Stream stops abruptly
What Happened: Transcode takes 5s But segment is only 4s Buffer growing
Drop 1080p variant Keep 720p, 480p Reduces CPU load
Switch to "ultrafast" Lower quality but faster Catches up on buffer
Add more transcoder cores Distribute load (Takes 60s to spin up)
What Happened: Origin server crashes Viewers can't fetch playlist Stream appears offline
Load balancer routes to standby origin server < 5s switchover
What Happened: CDN edge location saturated High latency for viewers Buffering issues
DNS switches to backup CDN (Cloudflare) Players redirect
Adaptive bitrate kicks in Players drop to 480p Reduces bandwidth need
Example: If thumbnail service fails 3x, skip thumbnails for all streams for 5 minutes
Example: Stream 1 overload doesn't affect Stream 2 (separate worker pools)
Principle: Multiple copies of critical components
